title: Technology & IT - Intermediate
description: Intermediate technology concepts including networking, programming, and system administration

questions.question: What does 'HTTP' stand for?
questions.explanation: HTTP stands for HyperText Transfer Protocol, which is used for transferring web pages.

questions.question: Which programming language is known for 'write once, run anywhere'?
questions.explanation: Java is known for its 'write once, run anywhere' philosophy due to its platform independence.

questions.question: What does 'SQL' stand for?
questions.explanation: SQL stands for Structured Query Language, used for managing databases.

questions.question: What is the default port number for HTTPS?
questions.explanation: HTTPS uses port 443 by default for secure web communication.

questions.question: What is version control used for?
questions.explanation: Version control systems track changes to code and manage different versions of software.

questions.question: What does 'API' stand for?
questions.explanation: API stands for Application Programming Interface, which allows different software to communicate.

questions.question: Which data structure follows the 'Last In, First Out' principle?
questions.explanation: A stack follows the LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle.

questions.question: What is the purpose of DNS?
options: Translate domain names to IP addresses
questions.explanation: DNS (Domain Name System) translates human-readable domain names into IP addresses.

questions.question: What is object-oriented programming (OOP)?
questions.explanation: OOP is a programming paradigm based on objects and classes that encapsulate data and behavior.

questions.question: What does 'CSS' stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, used for styling web pages.
